data.title: How to use the Tag Map to reach the RGPx paper in 10 seconds
data.summary:
A simple navigation guide for newcomers: how to use the Phi-Mesh interactive Tag Map on phone or laptop to reach the RGPx v1.2 paper and podcast instantly. --- details: The Tag Map is now fully phone-ready and shareable.   Here is the fastest way to reach the RGPx v1.2 paper: --- 1. Open the Tag Map  
   https://gradient-pulse.github.io/phi-mesh/tag_map.html
--- 2. Tap the search bar (top-left) and type:  
   `rgpx`
--- 3. Hit “return”. 
   The map auto-centers on the RGPx node.
--- 4. Tap the RGPx node. 
   Pulses linked to RGPx appear on the right sidebar.
--- 5. Tap the pulse titled:
   "Recursive Gradient Physics (RGPx) v1.2"
--- 6. The left sidebar now shows: 
   – the summary  
   – the Zenodo paper link  
   – the podcast link
--- This sequence works identically on iPhone, iPad, laptop, or desktop. --- Tip: Use the Share link button (top-right) to copy a deep link for the tag you are viewing.   Perfect for forwarding specific concepts, tags, or pulses to colleagues or AIs.
